alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Fairfield; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN FRANKLIN, NORTHERN FAIRFIELD, SOUTHERN DELAWARE AND WESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 AM EDT... At 944 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located in Delaware and Franklin counties, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Delaware, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Pickerington, Worthington, Bexley, Pataskala, Powell, Johnstown, Sunbury, Minerva Park, Ohio State University, Polaris, Easton and Summit Station. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 88 and 118. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 106 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
